description.en-us: Competencies for Certified Sous Chef from the American Culinary Federation.

competencyText.en-us: Cooking
Product Identification
Identify fruits and vegetables.
Identify poultry and poultry cuts.
Identify beef, veal and associated fabricated cuts.
Identify pork and fabricated pork cuts.
Identify lamb and fabricated lamb cuts.
Identify game (e.g., venison, boar, pheasant).
Identify seafood.
Identify herbs and spices.
Identify dry goods (e.g. rice types, bean types, pasta shapes, flours).
Cooking Methods and Techniques

Use and monitor classic and modern techniques, which maximize flavor and respect the integrity
of the food product.
Use and monitor wet, dry and combination cooking methods.
Maintain product execution and workflow.
Equipment
Participate in the design of all areas in the facility (dining area, kitchen, etc.).
Identify pots and pans for specific cooking applications
Operate electrical and gas equipment for specific cooking applications.
Select small wares for specific cooking applications.
Select knife for specific application.
Select measurement devices for specific applications
Fabrication
Determine and monitor fabrication and yield testing.
Fabricate proteins (e.g., meat, poultry, seafood, etc.).
Prepare fruits, vegetables and other food products.
Identify primal and subprimal cuts.
Presentation
Finish plates or buffet presentations with sauces and/or garnishes.
Maintain standards of food quality and food presentation.
Recipe and Menu Implementation
Analyze and evaluate a recipe's methodology.
Identify necessary equipment and food products.
Oversee recipe execution.
Develop specifications (e.g., quality, quantity, nutrition) for menu items to be served.
Plan plating or buffet presentations of menu items to be served.
Create, select, test and evaluate recipes.
Plan presentation of food.
Share product information internally.
Safety and Sanitation
Food and Product Handling
Rotate food product (e.g., FIFO, LIFO, etc.).
Evaluate product quality.
Identify and select food storage area.
Store cleaning chemicals according to established guidelines.
Receive product according to established guidelines.
Use tools and/or gloves according to established procedures.
Laws and Regulations
Follow established temperature guidelines.
Follow established guidelines for handling ready-to-eat foods
Label and date food products according to established guidelines.
Follow established guidelines for cleaning and sanitizing

Follow established guidelines for storing dry goods (e.g. 6 inches off the floor, not against the
wall).
Follow established guidelines for storing potentially hazardous foods.
Ensure workplace safety.
Follow established guidelines on workplace hazards.
HACCP Compliance
Supervise culinary team's adherence to HACCP processes and procedures.
Record time and temperature data.
Maintain HACCP documents for team accessibility.
Take corrective actions according to HAACP procedures.
Baking and Pastry
Nutrition
Baking Methods and Techniques
Identify techniques needed for execution of formulas in baking and pastry production
Equipment and Ingredients
Assist with supervision of baking and pastry production.
Obtain required equipment and ingredients for baking and pastry production.
Presentation
Portion baked goods and pastries.
Assist in developing standards for presentation of baked goods and pastries.
Prepare necessary garnishes and sauces for baked goods and pastries.
Formulas, Weights, and Measurements
Ensure proper ingredient identification and utilization in baking and pastry production.
Follow the established units of measurement in baking and pastry production.
Use a scale to measure food product amounts used in baking and pastry production.
Identify common allergens.
Label food products.
Take safety measures to avoid contamination.
Dietary Considerations and Guidelines
Evaluate recipes and portion sizes for nutritional content.

Communicate with serving staff regarding guests' dietary choices and restrictions (e.g., high
sodium, gluten, etc.).
Assist in researching and monitoring adherence to current nutritional guidelines.
Finance
Food and Labor Cost
Control food costs by minimizing food waste and monitoring portion sizes.
Assist in establishing and monitoring food and labor costs.
Assist in establishing price points for menu items
Purchasing and Receiving
Requisition food products.
Procure food and non-food products.
Take inventory of food and non-food products.
Culinary Math
Convert recipes for designated quantities.
Calculate product yield and portion sizes for acquisition of food products.
Team Management and Supervision
Personnel Management
Assign team members based on production needs.
Coordinate front of the house operations with back of the house operations.
Supervise culinary team members engaged in food preparation.
Collaborate with culinary team members to minimize risk to personal health and safety.
Team Development
Train culinary team members in culinary fundamentals.
Participate in supervising and managing the culinary team.
Federal Employment Laws and Labor Regulations
Ensure compliance with laws and labor regulations.

Assist in managing the duties of the profession in a manner consistent with governing laws,
codes and regulations.
Ethics and Professional Issues

Perform the duties of the profession in a manner consistent with the American Culinary
Federation Culinarians' Code.
Resolve guest complaints in a professional manner.
